meanings.definition: The condition of having a chromosome number that is higher than the normal diploid number.
meanings.sent1: Hyperploidy can lead to genetic abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the hyperploidy in the cell samples.
meanings.sent3: The hyperploidy of the fruit flies made them stand out in the genetic experiment.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, hyperploidy is like having extra puzzle pieces in a jigsaw.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful blocks to explain hyperploidy to the students.
